qas.question: When was hydrogen gas artificially produced for the first time?
Who first recognized that hydrogen was a discrete substance?
When it is burned what does hydrogen make?
What is the Greek translation for hydrogen?

context: Hydrogen gas was first artificially produced in the <a0_0>early 16th century<a0_0/>, via the mixing of metals with acids. In 1766–81, <a1_0>Henry Cavendish<a1_0/> was the first to recognize that hydrogen gas was a discrete substance, and that it produces <a2_0>water<a2_0/> when burned, a property which later gave it its name: in Greek, hydrogen means "<a3_0>water-former<a3_0/>".
